title.narrative: Development of teaching Physical Education at University of Dar es Salaam Department of Physical Education and Sports Sciences

description.narrative: The goal of the project is to improve the quality of physical education in all levels of education from primary schools to university level in Tanzania.At the moment the students of University of Dar es Salaam Department of Physical Education and Sports Sc iences (UDSM-PESS) can graduate as Bachelors. Project will support UDSM-PESS to develop the curriculum and increase the quality of Bachelors' Degree level.The project concentrates especially on development of didactics and pedagogy of the physical educatio n in Tanzania. These are the cornerstones of development of PE in Tanzania as the quality of pedagogy is poor.There are about 10-30 students of each class at UDSM-PESS. Several of them continue to teachers colleges as sports tutors. LiiKe has supported 12 colleges in PE and Health Education (HE) in 2009-14.The cooperative partner of LiiKe in the project is University of Jyvaskyla Department of Sports Sciences (JyU) which is specialized in teaching pedagogy and didactics. The project invites the tutors from teachers colleges to update their knowledge and increase the capacity on pedagogy and teaching methods. Once returning to the teacher's colleges they are able to increase the quality of teaching to improve the knowledge of students becoming primary and sec ondary school teachers in PE.Almost all PE teachers lack of skills in teaching pedagogy and teaching different sports. The project will support their future capacity to teach and the results will be seen in all levels of education.To sustain good knowledge in the UDSM-PESS there is a need to increase the number of postgraduate students as well. At the moment there are 3 post graduate students outside Tanzania studying PE. One is in UK (Joyce Ndabi) one in Sweden (John Kazungu) and one in Kenya (Ismail Panga ni). Currently there are three Ph. Doctors in PE (Mr. Hamad Ndee 62 Mr. Cyprian Maro 46 and Mr. Steven Mbagala 46) and two not defended (Jonas Tiboroa Devota Marwa) at University of Dar es Salaam. Within the next 4 years all post graduate students will ret urn to UDSM-PESS and strengthen the bachelor's degree program. The project will also assist minimum one student annually to start the post graduate studies at the Jyvaskyla University Department of Physical Education. This ensures the continuation of the g ood quality Bachelor's degree studies in UDSM-PESS.
